comments.author: Alicia Smith

comments.text:
Goodness this is so cute! I absolutely adore Snow Leopards and seeing those 
cubs just being energetic fluff-balls cheers me up no-end.
It's such a shame they're under such threat. 

They, like all big cats, are beautiful and stunning creatures and it would 
be a fine thing if they stayed like that for many, many more decades.  
Centuries if possible.  I, as I'm sure many people will agree with, would 
hate to see these wonderful creatures become just another history lesson.﻿

comments.text:
+keirdelay Forgot to add, if you don't want to donate money out right you 
can buy nice t-shirts w/ their (snow leopard.org) logo, or other products 
or "adopt" a snow leopard, stuff like that. It's one of the few places I 
trust w/ my donations anymore. You have to be so careful these days but 
this is one org I'm very familiar with & for several years if you decide to 
donate.
comments.author: keirdelay

comments.text:
There are only about 3000 left in the wild. That would be classified as 
extremely endangered particularly as several are killed every year by 
farmers protecting their livestock. However there are programs teaching 
these people not to kill the animals & they are being reimbursed for the 
loss of their livestock instead from governments involved in conservation 
programs & through private funding & donations. These farmers are very poor 
people in mountain communities, not poachers. You can donate yourself to 
places like snowleopard.org. I send money monthly. Not a lot ($20, all I 
can afford) but still, something.
comments.author: keirdelay
